column4: Hey guys, this would be the first time I've installed ubuntu while an existing Windows installation was there. Can I expect a pretty smooth experience for side-by-side?
I think this has improved hugely and was wondering if it was mostly painless now with the ubuntu installer.
I want to install it beside my Windows installation, which is currently the full partition. My understanding is the installer will resize the partition (I hope?) :)
do you know how many partitions you have now on the HD?
yes, I built the computer :) no system restore partition or anything like that

maybe I learn something today :) I did the installation myself, but I'll be honest I never knew there was a need for a "boot partition" I thought that the boot record was sort of this mysterious thing hidden at the beginning of the HD but was "some other thing"
there is a need for one but if you let the windows autoinstall at least with W7 it makes one.

asked about the amount, I ssupect you know already the limitations of primaries 4 to a HD, ubuntu will go to a extended and boot, so 3 primaries and a extended, with logicals inside I build them ahead of time in gparted, and use the something else option to get the ubuntu in a premade logical.
I guess the side by side works fine, you are subject to the immovable paging files in windows so be prudent.
ps: the windows disk management tool was well aware of this and is currently shrinking my partition to half
cool the W7 virtual partitioner saves a few lives I will bet. :D
